cutscene.speaker: Lissa
cutscene.line: Chrom, we have to do SOMETHING.

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: Well, what do you propose we do?

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: There are better places to take a nap than on the ground, you know.  Give me your hand.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: You all right?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Y-yes... Thank you, Chrom.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Ah, then you know who I am?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: No, actually. I... It's strange... Your name, it just...came to me...

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...Hmm, how curious. Tell me, what's your name? What brings you here?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: My name is... It's... Hmm?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...You don't remember your own name?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: I'm not sure if... I'm sorry, but where am I, exactly?

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Hey, I've heard of this! It's called amnesia!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: It's called a load of pegasus dung.  We're to believe you remember milord's name, but not your own?

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: B-but it's the truth!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: ...What if it IS true, Frederick? We can't just leave him/her here, alone and confused. What sort of Shepherds would we be then?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Just the same, milord. I must emphasize caution. 'Twould not do to let a wolf into our flock.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Right then—we'll take him/her back to town and sort this out here.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Wait just one moment. Do I have a say in this?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Peace, friend—I promise we'll hear all you have to say back in town. Now come.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: What will you do with me? Am I to be your prisoner?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Hah! You'll be free to go once we establish that you're no enemy of Ylisse.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Is that where we are? Ylisse?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: You've never heard of the halidom? Ha! Someone pay this actor/actress. He/She plays quite the fool! The furrowed brow is especially convincing…

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Frederick, please.  This land is known as the Halidom of Ylisse. Our ruler, Emmeryn, is called the exalt. I suppose proper introductions are in order... My name is Chrom—but then, you already knew that.  The delicate one here is my little sister, Lissa.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: I am NOT delicate! …Hmph!  Ignore my brother, please. He can be a bit thick sometimes. But you're lucky the Shepherds found you. Brigands would've been a rude awakening!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: Shepherds? You tend sheep? ...In full armor?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Heh, it's a dangerous job. Just ask Frederick the Wary here.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: A title I shall wear with pride. Gods forbid one of us keeps an appropriate level of caution. I have every wish to trust you, stranger, but my station mandates otherwise.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: I understand, sir. I would do no less myself. My name is Robin. …I just remembered that. How odd. I suppose that's one mystery solved.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Robin? Is that foreign? …Ah, well. We can discuss it later. We're almost to town. Once we—

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Chrom, look! The town!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Damn it! The town is ablaze! Those blasted brigands, no doubt... Frederick, Lissa! Quickly!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: What about him/her?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Unless he's/she's on fire as well, it can wait!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Aptly put, milord.

intro.speaker: Lissa
intro.line: Let's go already!

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: But what about— Hmm...

battle.speaker: Garrick
battle.line: Gwa ha ha! Get to it, lads! Grab anything shiny, and put the rest to the torch! We gots an example to set for these Ylissean types! Ain't that right, lass?

battle.speaker: Maiden
battle.line: S-stay away from me! Please! Someone! HEEEEEELP!

battle.speaker: Lissa
battle.line: Chrom, we have to stop them!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Don't worry—after today, these bandits won't be bothering anyone ever again…

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Wait!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Robin! You followed us! Why?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: I… I'm not certain myself. But I'm armed, and I know my way around a fight if you'll have me.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Of course—strength in numbers. Just stay close!

battle.speaker: Frederick
battle.line: Remember, Robin, we face practiced thieves and murderers. They will grant us no quarter. It's kill or be killed.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: So, Robin, I see you wear a sword. Is it— Wait, is that a tome? …You know magic?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: I…believe so? I suppose I should check.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: You "believe so"? Perhaps I'll just keep a few paces behind you for the time being…

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: No, I can control it. I'm sure. Now, how did this work again? Ah, yes…

battle.speaker: Lissa
battle.line: We'll see who's delicate! I may not be able to attack like Chrom, but when you get injured? I'll be the one stitching your bones back together, care of my trusty staff! You just tell me where to go, Robin.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Is anyone hurt? It would be foolish to leave a wound untreated.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Indeed. Timely use of a staff or a vulnerary should prevent the worst.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Still with us, Robin?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Hmm… It's strange. Here on the battlefield, I can… Well, I can "see" things.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: See things? Like what?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: The enemy's strength, their weaponry, the flow of battle… I must have studied this somewhere.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: So, you're saying you can size up the enemy at a glance?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Yes, it would seem so. And perhaps more, if I apply myself…

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Are you all right, Robin? Don't rush into danger.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: I'm fine, Chrom. Don't worry.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: You've lent us your strength, and that makes you a friend. Having an ally by my side gives me courage.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Thank you, but…I think there's more to it than that.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: What do you mean?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: I believe there's a tactical advantage to fighting side by side… It's fuzzy… Wait, yes: working in pairs improves strength, defense, speed… Yes, yes, I'm sure of it!

boss.speaker: Garrick
boss.line: Here, sheepy sheepy! Come to the slaughter!

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Well, that's the end of that.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Lucky for the town, we were close by. But holy wow, Robin! You were incredible! Swords, sorcery, AND tactics! Is there anything you can't do?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You're certainly no helpless victim, that much is for sure.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Indeed. Perhaps you might even be capable of an explanation for how you came here?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: I understand your skepticism, Sir Frederick. And I cannot explain why only some knowledge has returned to me. But please, believe me. I have shared all that I know.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: You fought to save Ylissean lives. My heart says that's enough.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: And your mind, milord? Will you now heed its council as well?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Frederick, the Shepherds could use someone with Robin's talents. We've brigands and unruly neighbors, all looking to bloody our soil. Would you really have us lose such an able tactician? Besides, I believe his/her story, odd as it might be.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Th-thank you, Chrom.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: So how about it? Will you join us, Robin?

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: I would be honored.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Did you notice, milord? The brigands spoke with a Plegian accent.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Plegian? What's that?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Plegia is Ylisse's westerly neighbor. They send small bands into our territory, hoping to instigate a war.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: And it's the poor townsfolk who suffer! Totally innocent, and totally helpless...

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: They do have us, milady: Shepherds to protect the sheep. Do not be swept up in your anger. It will cloud your judgment.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: I know, I know... Don't worry. I'll get used to all this.

end.speaker: Villager
end.line: Milord, please! You must stay the night! We are simple folk of simple means, but we would gladly toast your valor with a feast!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: A most generous offer, sir, and no doubt your hospitality would be grand... But I'm afraid we must hurry back to Ylisstol.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Dark meat only for me, medium well, and no salt in the soup. I simply— Wait, what?! We're not staying?! But, Frederick, it's nearly dark!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: When night falls, we'll camp. Eat off the land, make our bed of twigs and the like... I believe you mentioned you would be "getting used to this"?

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Frederick? Sometimes I hate you.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: You've quite the stern lieutenant there.

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: Yeah, well, "stern" is one name for it. I can think of a few others!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Frederick only smiles when he's about to bring down the axe.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Duly noted.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: *Ahem* You do realize I AM still present?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Oh, we realize.

end.speaker: Robin
end.line: Heh heh.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Milord remains as amusing as ever. Now then, shall we be going?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: All right, all right. Ready to go, Robin? The capital isn't far.
